Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, sequence truncation, bacteria-derived, natural derivatives

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is unique and shows only very low similarity (41.05%) toAntiviral lectin scytovirin (SVN)G: 18%, S: 15%, N: 15%.Chemical modification: two S-S bonds.Activity: inhibited HIV-1 (EC50 34.5 nM).MOA:virus:  it appears to bind gp120 (44%) and gp41 (70%) of intact SVN.Recombinant production:bacteria:Escherichia coli: pET32c(+) vector, fused with thioredoxin, His-tag, enterokinase digestion.  Yield: 2.2 mg/L.
Literature Information.Author: Xiong C, O'Keefe BR, Byrd RA, McMahon JB.2006
Literature Information.Title: Potent anti-HIV activity of scytovirin domain 1 peptide.
